tit.cmt: 指示書に基づき、Kitora-kofun Tumulusとしました。

sen.j: キトラ古墳（キトラこふん）は、奈良県高市郡明日香村にある古墳。
sen.e: Kitora Kofun is located in Asuka-mura, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Kitora Kofun is located in Asuka-mura, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Kitora-kofun Tumulus is located in Asuka-mura, Takaichi County, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 指示書に基づき、Kitora-kofun Tumulus、Takaichi Countyとしました。

sen.j: 近年では壁画が発見されており、高松塚古墳と共に保存事業が進められている。
sen.e: In recent years, mural paintings were discovered in this Kofun, for which a preservation project has been carried on as in the case of Takamatsuzuka Kofun.
In recent years, mural paintings were discovered in this Kofun, for which a preservation project has been carried on as in the case of Takamatsuzuka Kofun.
In recent years, mural paintings were discovered in this tumulus, for which a preservation project has been carried on as in the case of Takamatsuzuka-kofun Tumulus.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 二段築成作りの円墳である。
sen.e: It is a round tumulus constructed with the double- terraced slope of a mound.
It is a round tumulus constructed with the double-terraced slope of a mound.
It is a round tumulus constructed with the double-terraced slope of a mound.

sen.j: 墳丘は小高い阿部山の南斜面に位置している。
sen.e: The tumulus is located on the south hillside of slightly high Mt. Abe.
The tumulus is located on the south hillside of slightly high Mt. Abe.
The tumulus is located on the south hillside of slightly high Mt. Abe.

sen.j: 名称の「キトラ」は、「北浦」の転訛といわれる。
sen.e: The name, 'Kitora' is said to be a corruption of 'Kitaura.'
The name, 'Kitora' is said to be a corruption of 'Kitaura.'
The name, 'Kitora' is said to be a corruption of 'Kitaura.'

sen.j: 1983年11月7日、石室内の彩色壁画に玄武が発見され、注目を集めた。
sen.e: On November 7, 1983, Genbu (god of water who protects a north direction) was discovered on color mural paintings in the rock chamber.
On November 7, 1983, Genbu (god of water who protects the northern direction) was discovered on color mural paintings in the rock chamber.
On November 7, 1983, Genbu (god of water who protects the northern direction) was discovered on color mural paintings in the rock chamber.

sen.j: 2000年7月31日、国指定史跡に指定され、同年11月24日には特別史跡に指定された。
sen.e: On July 31, 2000, it was designated as a historical site by the Government and on November 24 in the same year, as a special historical site.
On July 31, 2000, it was designated as a historical site by the Government and on November 24 in the same year, as a special historical site.
On July 31, 2000, it was designated as a historical site by the Government and on November 24 in the same year, as a special historical site.

sen.j: 円墳であり、四神を描いた壁画があるなどの類似点から、高松塚古墳の「兄弟」といわれることがある。
sen.e: It is sometimes called a 'brother' of Takamatsuzuka Kofun due to the similarity between the two in that they are round tumuli and have mural paintings of Shijin (four gods said to rule over the four directions) and so on.

It is sometimes called a 'brother' of Takamatsuzuka Kofun due to the similarity between the two in that they are round tumuli and have mural paintings of Shijin (four gods said to rule over the four directions) and so on.

It is sometimes called a 'brother' of Takamatsuzuka-kofun Tumulus due to the similarity between the two in that they are round tumuli and have mural paintings of Shijin (four gods said to rule over the four directions) and so on.

sen.j: 壁画などにみられる唐の文化的影響が高松塚古墳ほどには色濃くないことから、遣唐使が日本に帰国（704年）する以前の7世紀末から8世紀初め頃に作られた古墳であると見られている。
sen.e: The influence of Tang culture shown on mural paintings and so on appears not so noticeably in it as in Takamatsuzuka Kofun, therefore, it is considered to have been constructed from around the end of 7th century to the early 8th century before Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) returned to Japan (704).

The influence of Tang culture shown on mural paintings and so on appears not so noticeably in it as in Takamatsuzuka Kofun, therefore, it is considered to have been constructed from around the end of 7th century to the early 8th century before Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) returned to Japan (704).

The influence of Tang culture shown on mural paintings and so on appears not so noticeably in it as in Takamatsuzuka-kofun Tumulus, therefore, it is considered to have been constructed from around the end of seventh century to the early eighth century before Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) returned to Japan (704).

sen.j: 誰が埋葬されているかは未だ判然としていない。
sen.e: Who was buried in it has not been known yet.
Who was buried in it is not yet known.
Who was buried in it is not yet known.

sen.j: 年代などから、天武天皇の皇子、もしくは側近の高官の可能性が高いと見られている。
sen.e: It is considered to be highly probable due to the era and so on that it was a Prince or a closely associated high officer of Emperor Tenmu.
It is considered to be highly probable due to the era and so on that it was a Prince or a closely associated high officer of Emperor Tenmu.
It is considered to be highly probable due to the era and so on that it was a Prince or a closely associated high officer of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: また、金象眼が出土したことから、銀装の金具が出土した高松塚古墳の埋葬者よりも身分や地位の低い人物が埋葬されていると推測される。
sen.e: Furthermore, since kinzogan (gold inlay) was excavated, it is presumed that the tomb owner was lower in the lineage and social position than that of Takamatsuzuka Kofun was, where silver-plated metal fixtures were excavated.

Furthermore, since kinzogan (gold inlay) was excavated, it is presumed that the tomb owner was lower in the lineage and social position than that of Takamatsuzuka Kofun was, where silver-plated metal fixtures were excavated.

Furthermore, since kinzogan (gold inlay) was excavated, it is presumed that the tomb owner was lower in the lineage and social position than that of Takamatsuzuka-kofun Tumulus was, where silver-plated metal fixtures were excavated.

sen.j: 白石太一郎や直木孝次郎は、被葬者は右大臣の阿倍御主人（あべのみうし）であったと主張している。
sen.e: Taichiro SHIRAISHI and Kojiro NAOKI maintain that the tomb owner was ABE no Miushi, Minister of the Right.
Taichiro SHIRAISHI and Kojiro NAOKI maintain that the tomb owner was ABE no Miushi, Minister of the Right.
Taichiro SHIRAISHI and Kojiro NAOKI maintain that the tomb owner was ABE no Miushi, Minister of the Right.

sen.j: その根拠として、古墳周辺の一帯が「阿部山」という名前の地名であることを挙げている。
sen.e: They mentioned as an evidence that the whole area around the Kofun is called 'Mt. Abe' as a place name.
They mentioned as evidence that the whole area around the Kofun is called 'Mt. Abe' as a place name.
They mentioned as evidence that the whole area around the tumulus is called 'Mt. Abe' as a place name.

sen.j: 岸俊男などもその蓋然性が極めて高いと考え支持している。
sen.e: Toshio KISHI supports their opinion saying the probability of that being true is extremely high.
Toshio KISHI supports their opinion saying the probability of that being true is extremely high.
Toshio KISHI supports their opinion saying the probability of that being true is extremely high.

sen.j: 阿倍御主人は大宝3（703）年4月右大臣従二位、69歳で没する（『続日本紀』『公卿補任』）。
sen.e: ABE no Miushi, Minister of the Right, Junii (Junior Second Rank) died in April 703 at the age of 69 ("Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), "Kugyobunin" (directory of court nobles)).
sen.cmt: 「大宝3（703）年4月」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦703年4月25日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: ABE no Miushi, Minister of the Right, Junii (Junior Second Rank) died in April 703 at the age of 69 ("Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), "Kugyobunin" (directory of court nobles)).
ABE no Miushi, Minister of the Right, Junii (Junior Second Rank) died in April 703 at the age of 69 ("Shoku Nihongi" [Chronicle of Japan Continued], "Kugyobunin" [directory of court nobles]).

sen.j: また猪熊兼勝は、天武天皇の皇子の高市皇子という説を主張。
sen.e: On the other hand, Kanekatsu INOKUMA maintained it was Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) of Emperor Tenmu.
On the other hand, Kanekatsu INOKUMA maintained it was Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) of Emperor Tenmu.
On the other hand, Kanekatsu INOKUMA maintains it was Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 千田稔は、百済から渡来した百済王昌成（しょうじょう）を被葬者に挙げる。
sen.e: Minoru SENDA mentioned as the tomb owner Kudara no Konikishi Shojo who immigrated to Japan from Kudara (Paekche).
Minoru SENDA mentioned as the tomb owner Kudara no Konikishi Shojo, who immigrated to Japan from Kudara (Paekche).
Minoru SENDA mentions as the tomb owner Kudara no Konikishi Shojo, who immigrated to Japan from Kudara (Paekche).

sen.j: 二段築成作りの円墳である。
sen.e: It is a round tumulus constructed with the double- terraced slope of a mound.
It is a round tumulus constructed with the double-terraced slope of a mound.
It is a round tumulus constructed with the double-terraced slope of a mound.

sen.j: 上段が直径9.4m、高さ2.4m、テラス状の下段が直径13.8m、高さ90cm。
sen.e: The upper stage is 9.4 meters in diameter and 2.4 meters high, and the lower terrace 13.8 meters in diameter and 90 centimeters high.
The upper stage is 9.4 meters in diameter and 2.4 meters high, and the lower terrace 13.8 meters in diameter and 90 centimeters high.
The upper stage is 9.4 meters in diameter and 2.4 meters high, and the lower terrace 13.8 meters in diameter and 90 centimeters high.

sen.j: 石槨は凝灰岩の切石を組み合わせて作られており、内部は幅約1m、長約2.6m、高さ約1.3m。
sen.e: The stone burial chamber was constructed by combining cut stones of tuff and the inside is approx. one meter wide, approx. 2.6 meters long and approx. 1.3 meters high.
The stone burial chamber was constructed by combining cut stones of tuff and the inside is approx. one meter wide, approx. 2.6 meters long and approx. 1.3 meters high.
The stone burial chamber was constructed by combining cut stones of tuff and the inside is approx. one meter wide, approx. 2.6 meters long and approx. 1.3 meters high.

sen.j: 内壁・天井には漆が塗られ、壁画がほどこされている。
sen.e: The interior wall and ceiling are painted with Urushi (Japanese lacquer) and mural paintings were drawn.
The interior wall and ceiling are painted with Urushi (Japanese lacquer) and mural paintings were drawn.
The interior wall and ceiling are painted with Urushi (Japanese lacquer) and mural paintings were drawn.

sen.j: 壁画
sen.e: Mural paintings
Mural paintings
Mural paintings

sen.j: 東西南北の四壁の中央に四神の青龍、白虎、朱雀、玄武が描かれている。
sen.e: Shijin, i.e., Seiryu (blue dragon), Byakko (White Tiger), Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix) and Genbu (god of water) were drawn on the center of the four walls of east, west, south and north respectively.
Shijin, i.e. Seiryu (blue dragon), Byakko (White Tiger), Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix) and Genbu (god of water) were drawn on the center of the four walls of east, west, south and north respectively.
Shijin, i.e. Seiryu (blue dragon), Byakko (white tiger), Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix) and Genbu (god of water) were drawn on the center of the four walls of east, west, south and north respectively.
sen.cmt: 他の表記に合わせ、White Tiger→white tigerとしました。

sen.j: 四神の下に、それぞれ3体ずつ十二支の獣面（獣頭）人身像が描かれていると想定されている。
sen.e: It is estimated that three figures of animal head with human body based on the Junishi (12 signs of the Chinese zodiac) are drawn below each of the Shijin.
It is estimated that three figures with animal heads on human bodies based on the Junishi (12 signs of the Chinese zodiac) are drawn below each of the Shijin.
It is estimated that three figures with animal heads on human bodies based on the Junishi (12 signs of the Chinese zodiac) are drawn below each of the Shijin.

sen.j: しかし、北壁・玄武の「子（ね）」、東壁・青龍の「寅（とら）」、西壁・白虎の「戌（いぬ）」、南壁・朱雀の「午（うま）」など6体の発見に留まっている。
sen.e: However, only six have been discovered so far, including 'Ne' (Mouse) below north/Genbu, 'Tora' (Tiger) below east/Seiryu, 'Inu' (Dog) below west/Byakko and 'Uma' (Horse) below south/Suzaku.
However, only six have been discovered so far, including 'Ne' (Mouse) below north/Genbu, 'Tora' (Tiger) below east/Seiryu, 'Inu' (Dog) below west/Byakko and 'Uma' (Horse) below south/Suzaku.
However, only six have been discovered so far, including 'Ne' (Mouse) below north/Genbu, 'Tora' (Tiger) below east/Seiryu, 'Inu' (Dog) below west/Byakko and 'Uma' (Horse) below south/Suzaku.

sen.j: 同時代の中国や朝鮮半島では獣頭人身を象った浮き彫りや土人形が埋葬された墓が発見されているため、キトラ古墳は中国や朝鮮半島などの文化的影響を受けていたと考えられている。
sen.e: Due to the fact that embossed carvings and clay dolls of animal head with human body have been discovered in ancient tomes of the same era in China and the Korean Peninsula, Kitora Kofun is considered to have been influenced by the cultures of China and the Korean Peninsula.

Due to the fact that embossed carvings and clay dolls of animal heads on human bodies have been discovered in ancient tombs of the same era in China and the Korean Peninsula, Kitora Kofun is considered to have been influenced by the cultures of China and the Korean Peninsula.

Due to the fact that embossed carvings and clay dolls of animal heads on human bodies have been discovered in ancient tombs of the same era in China and the Korean Peninsula, Kitora-kofun Tumulus is considered to have been influenced by the cultures of China and the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: しかし、2005年になって発見された「午」の衣装は、同じ南壁に描かれている朱雀と同じ朱色であった。
sen.e: However, the costume of 'Uma' discovered in 2005 was drawn in Shu-iro (Empire red), the same color as that of Suzaku which was drawn on the same south wall.
However, the costume of 'Uma' discovered in 2005 was drawn in Shu-iro (Empire red), the same color as that of Suzaku which was drawn on the same south wall.
However, the costume of 'Uma' discovered in 2005 was drawn in Shu-iro (Empire red), the same color as that of Suzaku which was drawn on the same south wall.

sen.j: このことは、十二支像がそれぞれの属する方角によって四神と同様に塗り分けられていることを推測させる。
sen.e: From this, it is presumed that each of the Junishi figures was drawn in the same color as one of Shijin to which it belongs.
From this, it is presumed that each of the Junishi figures was drawn in the same color as one of Shijin to which it belongs.
From this, it is presumed that each of the Junishi figures was drawn in the same color as one of Shijin to which it belongs.

sen.j: これは中国・朝鮮の例には見られない特色である。
sen.e: This is a characteristic which has not been found in China and Korea.
This is a characteristic which has not been found in China and Korea.
This is a characteristic which has not been found in China and Korea.

sen.j: 天井には本格的な天文図があり、太陽、月、星座、赤道などが描かれていた。
sen.e: There was a full-scale astronomical chart, on which the sun, the moon, constellation, equator and so on were drawn.
There was a full-scale astronomical chart, on which the sun, the moon, constellation, equator and so on were drawn.
There was a full-scale astronomical chart, on which the sun, the moon, constellation, equator and so on were drawn.

sen.j: 中国や朝鮮などに残っている最古の天文図は11世紀や12世紀のものであるから、現存する天文図のなかでは世界最古ではないかと注目されている。
sen.e: The astronomical chart has received attention due to a possibility that it be the world oldest chart among the existing astronomical charts, since the oldest astronomical charts existing in China and Korea are those of the 11th and the 12 century.

The astronomical chart has received attention due to a possibility that it is the world's oldest chart among existing astronomical charts, since the oldest astronomical charts existing in China and Korea are those of the 11th and the 12 century.

The astronomical chart has received attention due to a possibility that it is the world's oldest chart among existing astronomical charts, since the oldest astronomical charts existing in China and Korea are those of the 11th and the 12 century.

sen.j: 現在、古墳一帯は国営飛鳥歴史公園の一部として整備が進められている。
sen.e: At the present time, the whole area around the Kofun is being developed as a part of the Asuka Historical National Government Park.
At the present time, the whole area around the Kofun is being developed as a part of the Asuka Historical National Government Park.
At the present time, the whole area around the tumulus is being developed as a part of the Asuka Historical National Government Park.

sen.j: 発掘後、湿気のため石室内にカビが発生し、壁画の変質が進行していることが判明した。
sen.e: It came to be known some time after excavation that deterioration of the mural paintings was in progress due to mold growing in the rock chamber caused by humidity.
It came to be known some time after excavation that deterioration of the mural paintings was in progress due to mold growing in the rock chamber caused by humidity.
It came to be known some time after excavation that deterioration of the mural paintings was in progress due to mold growing in the rock chamber caused by humidity.

sen.j: このため壁画をはぎ取り、保存する作業が行われている。
sen.e: Therefore, a countermeasure is being performed by removing the mural paintings from the wall to preserve them.
Therefore, a countermeasure is being performed by removing the mural paintings from the wall to preserve them.
Therefore, a countermeasure is being performed by removing the mural paintings from the wall to preserve them.

sen.j: 文化庁は2004年8月より、損傷の激しいものから順次はぎ取り作業を開始。
sen.e: The Agency for Cultural Affairs started removing the mural paintings in order of seriousness of damage from August 2004.
The Agency for Cultural Affairs started removing the mural paintings in order of seriousness of damage from August 2004.
The Agency for Cultural Affairs started removing the mural paintings in order of seriousness of damage from August 2004.

sen.j: 同庁によれば、2007年2月15日までに南壁の朱雀がはぎ取られ、確認されている壁画のはぎ取り作業は（天井の天文図を除き）完了した。
sen.e: According to the Agency, Suzaku was cut out from the south wall by February 15, 2007, by which the removing work of all the mural paintings discovered was completed (except for the astronomical chart on the ceiling).

According to the Agency, Suzaku was cut out from the south wall by February 15, 2007, by which the removing work of all the mural paintings discovered was completed (except for the astronomical chart on the ceiling).

According to the Agency, Suzaku was cut out from the south wall by February 15, 2007, by which the removing work of all the mural paintings discovered was completed (except for the astronomical chart on the ceiling).

sen.j: 一部が2009年5月8日から同24日まで奈良文化財研究所飛鳥資料館にて一般公開される。
sen.e: Some of them will be opened to the public at Asuka Historical Museum of Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties from May 8, 2009 to May 24.
Some of them will be opened to the public at Asuka Historical Museum of Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties from May 8, 2009 to May 24.
Some of them will be opened to the public at Asuka Historical Museum of Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties from May 8, 2009 to May 24.

sen.j: 研究・保存・公開などは奈良市にある奈良文化財研究所が主となっている。
sen.e: Research, preservation and exhibitions are mainly managed by the Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties.
Research, preservation and exhibitions are mainly managed by the Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties.
Research, preservation and exhibitions are mainly managed by the Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties.

sen.j: 80+10円付加金付き特殊切手が2種類、2003年10月15日に発行された。
sen.e: Two kinds of \80+\10 special postage stamps with donation were issued on October 15, 2003.
Two kinds of 80+10yen special postage stamps with donation were issued on October 15, 2003.
Two kinds of 80+10yen special postage stamps with donation were issued on October 15, 2003.
